evidence: Single package structure with clear module separation in subdirectories (_base, _configs, _elements, _functions, _pages, _units)
High average fan-out (4.84) indicating extensive cross-module dependencies
Maximum directory depth of 3 suggests flat modular organization
Clear separation of concerns with dedicated modules for different functionalities (browser automation, element handling, page management)
Evidence of internal APIs with abstract base classes (BasePage, BaseElement, BaseParser)
Multiple cohesive functional units organized in distinct modules
Presence of both Chromium-based and Session-based page handling indicating unified but modular approach
risks: High fan-out may indicate tight coupling between modules
Single package structure limits deployment flexibility
Complex internal dependencies may impact maintainability
